page.title: 08FARMING
page.content: Here is a list of different kinds of farming in our area: dairy,beef,arable and livery. For feeding, the farmers grow long grass for hay and silage which is stored for the winter.Corn is grown to provide straw for feeding and bedding.The ears of corn are kept or sold for animal feed.Kale is grown for strip grazing in the Winter. Much of the soil is sandy loam. Barnett Farm, Wonersh At the moment there are 36 cows,the best are producing about 2 1/2 litres each milking,5 litres a day.The poorest cows are producing about a litre a day. Normally if a cow gives less than 1 1/2 litres a day they are taken to Tadworth to be destroyed then taken away in large freezer container lorries to be shipped abroad,or to be cut up for dog and cat meat or(CONT.)
